page.title: 02BURTON JOYCE-LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: In the original Domesday Book,Bertune is mentioned.It was evidently a small village,though it could boast a church and a priest,a meadow and woodland pasture,the value of the village being one silver mark. Bertune could mean either"the farm on the hill"or"the farm in a fortified place"and for centuries,Burton Joyce remained an agricultural village.Some of the names of the roads (Willow Wong,Criftin) testify to this. Today,Burton Joyce,Bulcote and Stoke Bardolph boast a population of 3,591 according to the 1981 census;a number which continues to grow.Burton Joyce has three churches,a school,three public houses,numerous shops and a variety of architectural styles.There are also two neighbouring buildings, Braybrook,a home for the elderly,and Westwolds,catering for the blind.
